meanings.definition: A condition in which one type of stimulation evokes the sensation of another, as when the hearing of a sound produces the visualization of a color.
meanings.sent1: Her synaesthesia made music feel like a painting.
meanings.sent2: His synaesthesia allowed him to see colors when he heard music.
meanings.sent3: The artist's synaesthesia turned the world into a symphony of hues.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, synaesthesia transformed every sound into a vibrant rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The synaesthesia in her mind painted a beautiful picture of the music she heard.

meanings.definition: The production of a sense impression relating to one sense or part of the body by stimulation of another sense or part of the body.
meanings.sent1: His synaesthesia made him taste words as he read them.
meanings.sent2: The synaesthesia in her mind made her feel the warmth of the sun when she heard a bird sing.
meanings.sent3: The chef's synaesthesia led to some interesting flavor combinations in his dishes.
meanings.sent4: The synaesthesia of the dancer's movements created a sensory feast for the audience.
meanings.sent5: The synaesthesia in his mind turned every touch into a symphony of sensations.
